author: whyrusleeping
content: Tricky bit we ran into though, we allowed miners to include any message they wanted to, regardless of the base fee, but the miner has to pay the difference if that messages fee cap is below the base fee, capped at the block reward. Since its a testnet, and miners wanted to maximize the throughput, they just packed their blocks entirely full, spiking up the base fee astronomically

author: whyrusleeping
content: I could potentially see miners doing this in Eth if beetcoin farming becomes more profitable to miners than foregoing block rewards and tx fees

author: whyrusleeping
content: Though that would definitely be a weird edgecase

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!91365817869946880> You mean the miners were paying for transaction gas themselves?

author: sky.cactus
content: As in, miners were paying for *other people's* transactions?

author: rinku6993
content: I think someone given the proof that miners still paying for transaction gas themselves.

author: sky.cactus
content:
> I could potentially see miners doing this in Eth if beetcoin farming becomes more profitable to miners than foregoing block rewards and tx fees
This doesn't have to be miners.  *Anyone* could spam the network with transactions to raise the base fee, and it would cost them exponentially more the longer the kept it up.  I'm not worried about such a vector personally.
